Title: OpenSSL: Denial of service
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in OpenSSL might allow remote attackers to cause a
    Denial of Service condition.

Background.Text: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

Description.Text: It was discovered that OpenSSL allow malicious servers to send very large primes to a client during DH(E) based TLS handshakes.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker, by sending large prime to client during DH(E) TLS handshake, could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All OpenSSL users should upgrade to the latest version:
